## Commit Message Guidelines

Use 1â€“3 emojis at the start of every commit message. Follow semantic-release format: {emoji(s)} {type}({scope}): {message}, using types like feat, fix, chore, or BREAKING CHANGE. Scope is optional, but the message must be clear, specific, and in present tenseâ€”never generic. Emojis are required for expressiveness and fast scanning. Semantic-release enables automated versioning and changelogs.
